channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Opens the Door a Bit Wider to Its Prestigious Club of Partners
item.description: The class of partners is the fourth under CEO David Solomon.

item.title: Affirm sees booming buy-now-pay-later growth, but stock dips after earnings
item.description: The company is seeing more of its business shift toward interest-bearing products.

item.title: Nasdaq, S&P Gain as Fed Cuts Interest Rates
item.description: U.S. stocks finished mostly higher, extending post-election gains as the Federal Reserve delivered another rate cut.

item.title: ‘I’m devastated she didn’t win’: I voted for Kamala Harris. Am I disloyal for taking advantage of the Trump stock-market rally?
item.description: “Am I trading off my candidate’s loss? Does that make me a turncoat?”

item.title: Rivian’s losses widen, but investors like hearing of ‘progress’ in next-gen EV
item.description: Rivian posted a wider loss and lower sales than Wall Street expected, but says it is making progress with its next-generation EV platform.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Falls as Storage Builds Continue
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures settled lower amid further storage builds ahead of the high-demand winter season, with inventories rising by 69 Bcf last week...

item.title: Stocks Keep Climbing as Fed Cuts Rates
item.description: Big tech stocks push higher, while the financial and industrial sectors pull back after Wednesday’s big gains; Lyft jumps 22%.

item.title: Pinterest’s stock tumbles as earnings show slim revenue beat
item.description: Pinterest Inc.’s stock tumbled 14% in after-hours trading Thursday after the company, which operates a platform for photo and video sharing, posted th...

item.title: Trump's New Wall Street Watchdogs Are Coming---Likely With a Lot Less Bite
item.description: The president-elect has said he would fire Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler “on day one.”

item.title: Consumer credit posts small increase as Americans cut back on credit-card purchases
item.description: The amount of credit U.S. consumers used in September rose a scant 1.4%, but the increase was tied mostly to student loan as Americans scale back on b...
